s.text: Bradley said it would cost "between $50 billion and $65 billion a year" and would be funded either "from the surplus" or "through the enormous savings that we can get through the application of technology to the medical system," such as "moving things from paper to Internet."
When Gore got his next chance to speak-in response to a different question-he turned back to the cost issue.

Gore also gets the benefit of triangulation.
